source_phase: Oh, no!
What?
This little guy looks terrible.
My oh my. Winter sure was hard on this poor, old garden. I've got a lot of work to do when I get back, eh?
Thank you, all of you! You're all so kind! You make a girl so happy!

You must be my new leading man. Aren't you handsome! But my gracious, you're so young! Tell me WHY do they keep casting me with such mere babes? I guess that's the curse of having an eternally young face.
Come, Sweetie! Take a bow! Gloria Von Gouten is not afraid to share the spotlight!
It's talent that lands the statues, boy! Come here! Let me show you my award!
Ahhh!
Ms. Von Gouton?
What's that, boy? I heard you! You think I'm old, washed-up, a has-been. I'll show you!
Ahhhh!
Ah, you decided to take one last curtain call after all! How nice!
I knew you'd return to the stage someday! They all do!
We've lost some of our best actors to this whole television thing, but I tell you it's just a fad!
Oh, please. It is my policy not to receive gifts from fans, because they already give me so much!
Is that for my hair? Thank you, but I bring my own hairdresser to every production.
Really! In my day, child, we didn't need props. We acted!
Oh, my robe, how nice of you. Not quite ready to go in yet, though, dear.
Oh! Oh, my! What happened? Did I faint again and not notice?
Please excuse me, but your taking me away from the fans.
Oh, pardon me!
You know, a better director wouldn't let us walk on each other like this.
Why, isn't that nice?
Oooh, that's not very nice.
Oh, my no. Not a standing ovation. Please! I don't deserve that! Oh...
Please, don't bother my audience.
Please don't do that.
Oh, my! Usher!
I'll talk to her as soon as her performance is over.
This audience is dead. I don't see any green on it anywhere.
Yes, go, please. My thoughts are hideous enough to myself. No one should have to suffer them but I.
Rrrrrr!
Rrrrr!
Man that lock's tough!
Yeah. I think we're definitely going to need Sasha and Milla's help with this one.
Yeah. You keep saying that.
Ah! Who are you working for?
Wh--uh... I'm with the Psychonauts!
The who? Oh, that doesn't fit in. That doesn't fit in at all. Maybe I've got this all wrong!
Who do YOU work for?
I'm the guard. I've been fully trained.
You gotta let me in! My friend's in there!
Sorry, the Milkman has the key. I am not the Milkman. I'm the guard.
Where's the Milkman?
I'll bet he's sleeping on the job. His milk is delicious. Everybody wants it. He'll be here soon.
Then the lies will end.
...the Milkman...
...those little green cops...
...the military-industrial complex...
...the suits...
...the analyticals, man...
...those Bermuda Triangle sharks
...all them haters...
...Hernando...
...that little fat kid with the bunny...
...the doctors back at the clinic...
...the pelicans...
...the squirrels...
...the manager of that boy band...
...those eggheads in their ivory tower...
...that guy with the eye patch...
...the psychowhatsits...
...the freaky hunchback girl who loves brains so much...
...the dairy industry...
...the kid with the goggles...
...the dog track regulators...
...the tuna canneries...
...the national park system...
...big oil...
...organized labor...
...the rodeo clown cartel...
...the media...
...the cows...
...foreign toy makers...
...the intelligencia...
...the fluoride producers
...a secret doomsday cult...
...the president's brother...
...my first cat Seymour...
...one of my nostril hairs...
...the intelligence community...
...the five richest families in the country...
...all those stupid crows...
...some sort of power, you know...
...or else, maybe...
...no, no, wait. I mean...
...in conjunction with...
...with the full blessing of...
...with the backing of...
...who are merely the pawns of...
...who are the puppet masters of...
...went to the prom with...
...ate a whole jar of olives with...
...are working for...
...are telling my location to...
...made a deal back in '68 with...
...sold their soul to...
...are controlled by...
...bought votes to protect...
...are doing the dirty work of...
...got in bed with...
...signed a secret treaty with...
...has been officially linked with...
...know the truth.
...won't stop visiting me.
...keep sparring with me.
...have been spitting on me all day.
...do this horrible thing, but in conjunction with who? Or whom?
...are crawling all over my skin.
...bit me all night so I couldn't sleep.
...have everyone fooled.
...were digging away at the plastics.
...were dialing in through the optics.
...stole my theories and reprinted them incorrectly, to discredit them.
...are not to be trusted.
...have been living off the teat of the dairy industry.
...have been fixing oil prices...
...assassinated the one man in their way...
...pretty much control everything.
...pick who lives and who dies and what the football scores are going to be every week.
...and they obviously...
...and I know they...
...but they can't hide that they...
...ha! Like I don't know that they...
...and, let's just say for now that they...
...and, if I know anything, I know that they...
...and sure as the nose on my face, I am sure they...
...to get ...
...because they want ...
...in order to monopolize...
...to keep down...
...so the people never find out about...
...and who wins? Them. Who loses?
...all in a big fight over...
...the truth.
...all of us.
...the whole sack of lies.
...the innocents.
...the biggest conspiracy of all.
...the infrastructure.
...the lap belt, man.
...the water supply.
...the rotundra.
...the A.M. tenderizer.
...last specimen of the super-virus.
...the witnesses.
...my hooch.
...the hanging udders.
...a clean-burning, perpetual energy source.
...a religious artifact with supposedly unimaginable powers.
...exactly what, nobody knows.
How long do they think they can hide that?
I mean, who do they think they're fooling?
Can I really be the only person who sees this?
Someone has to get this information to the people.
If they find out I know this stuff, I'm dead.
Oh, man. This stuff is hot.
...since the year dot.
...right under people's noses!
...and nobody seems to care!
Visiting hours are over!
Why does that hydrant keep looking at me?
You can pass it over the counter, but that don't make it over the counter!
No insubordination, right boss? Right?
Okay, Boss?
Hey, where is the boss?
Ignore it, Cooper!
I have to get rid of some of this stuff!
I have to stay focused.
No distractions!
What???
Oh, that doesn't fit. That doesn't fit at all.
Well, maybe if I forget about that other part.
Wait, why did I say that?
Oh, Boyd. You've got this all wrong.
Did I just think that? Or did someone MAKE me think it?
But when that happens, they turn it into CHOCOLATE milk, and nobody can tell the difference!
You know what I mean? Amounts tendered? Yeah?
The squirrels... have eyes.
Listen to me, listen to me, LISTEN TO ME!
Shut up, shut up, SHUT UP!
Shhh! No, wait. Say that again?
They think the windows are tinted, but they ain't tinted nearly enough!
Of course the milk's got spider webs in it! Taste it!
I scream, you scream, we all scream, we all scream...
The ice cream's in the web, the web is in the cream.
Oh, you think that's regular yarn, do you?
They come, they whisper, they watch, they chop, chop, chop.
What's that on your head? That's no hat. Maybe you could tell your hat to shut up? Or at least, ask me the right questions?
I wonder if I'm on camera right now. Ha! What, am I crazy? Of course I am!
Hi mom! Look at me! I'm tangled in a web of deception! How's uncle G?
G-man, who are you working for? Who is G?
G-Man, Go-man, Goat Man I thought you worked for me?
My father, he was a good man, but he served a cruel master.
Mom, are you sure these are your children?
These are not my dot to dots. These are not my babies.
...but of course you know all this because you're Australian...
...and then it comes out of those wires over there, and goes straight into my head, with all its little audio tricks
I don't want to be a lead weight on the table.
I see myself more as a turtle with a rocket strapped to its back!
...and he waits and he waits...
...this milk can't stay fresh forever...
...something's got to give...
How many are there? I count fourteen, but that's not the number on my hand, that's not the number on my neck.
The truth lives in a small house on the edge of town.
The truth is sleeping in glass box.
The truth is a colorful diamond.
I'm dropping out of this yogurt convention. There's no fruit at the bottom.
Hey! Lady! Where you going with that sweater?
Think you could get this past me? I'm the guard.
I've got the truth. It's tucked in my cheeks. I'm not going to eat it right now.
Are you buying? Or are you spying?
This is ugly. It's like a Cyclops with a million eyes!
The fire will start in menswear!
But what if the signal comes early?
The meaty bit in the middle of this won ton, it's me!
Hey, don't worry about me. I'm centered. I'm the whole center in fact.
Am I? Or is he? Am I he? What is he doing in my house?
Someone moved into my neighborhood, uninvited.
The housing committee's not going to like this.
They should paint their garage door the same color as everybody else's.
I'm locked on the outside, and I'm locked on the inside.
And the little girl stuck her finger in the dyke and saved all the windmills. But who does the little girl work for?
Hey, little girl! Get your finger out of there!
Ha! I know what you're up to.
You've got the skates, but I've got the key!
Who is the Milkman???
You know my house is clean, right? Right boss??
Get off of me!
I don't want any half and half! I'm already half and half!!
If I'm invisible, then why is everyone looking at me?
...heh heh.
...wait...
...uhhhh...
...hmmmm...
...yeah, yeah, yeah...
...no, no, no, no...
...okay, okay, but
...riiiiiiight...
...signed... Edgar... Teglee.
Fini!
When you deliver this to my patron, Raz, you may also hand him my farewell, for I am checking myself out of here.
You have unchained my mind, young friend so before I go, I'd like to show my gratitude by painting you a REAL work of art.
No bull?
Ha ha ha ha ha!
You make light of my mental problems, and still I have no rage! Amazing!
Greetings, Doctor Loboto!
Up to the secret laboratory then, is it?
One moment...
You're not Doctor Loboto!
My eyes may be half gone, but I would recognize the mad doctor anywhere.
He's got that stone cold face a man doesn't easily forget...
He wears a beastly smock, covered in thick straps like an electric chair...
And in the place where his hand should be, there's nothing but a gleaming, metal claw.
So if I'm not mistaken, you're not Doctor Loboto, and you don't pay my salary so kindly back away from my elevator and die.
Thank you, sir.
Good to see your face!
I see you're wearing your favorite jacket!
If I may say so, your claw is looking ESPECIALLY menacing today!
If you're Doctor Loboto
What happened to your face?
Where's your strappy jacket?
Did you have a human hand reattached to your arm, or...?
You inmates are getting ever more clever, but...
You still can't fool old Crispin Whytehead.
I'm an orderly you know. I am NOT an imposter.
Good day.
Taking her up yourself this time, eh Doctor? Less work for me!
Inmate Whytehead.
Gahh! Chief Orderly Bonaparte! You're... You're
Armed?
Woo hoo ha ha hahaha!
Hey it works!
What's up, Linda?
I don't suppose I could just ride on top this time?
You know, I'm not getting any more used to this.
You haven't been eating algae again, have you?
Prepare yourself for passage, human child.
Ya--
Behind you, General!
Oh, good move, mate.
Got 'em on the run now, eh, Bonaparte?
I hear you out there Fred!
Just because I can't see you doesn't mean I'm not watching!
Don't throw in the towel just yet!
You've still got a few more hens in your musket!
Heh. Look at 'im.
Sad isn't it?
He used to be just an average loon--didn't embarrass himself so much.
Now he's all kiltery-jiltery.
I used to play that little war game with him back when it WAS just a game to him.
Last time we played he lost the game and his mind. Now he thinks he's Napoleon of course.
Reduced to a cracker factory cliché!
One pickle short of a Sunday spice can, wouldn't you say?
Not much brine in his brisket, if you know what I mean.
Poor bastard.
Got a meter on his melon like half sack of cherries.
Tell me, what's he doing now? I can't see from here. Is he winning or losing?
Hey, how's that painting of Doctor Loboto coming along? You know, I'll deliver it for you as soon as it's finished.
Silence! I am conceptualizing.
Hey! I like it!
Ah, you see, the poor dumb beasts have no thumbs, so I ask you... how are they holding their cards?
St--St--Sticky paws?
It should be impossible, and yet somehow they go on... playing the game.
In the end, Razputin, aren't we all just dogs playing poker?
Hey, why are you all locked up?
Hmmm.
Why... am... I... all... locked... up?
Good question.
What ya paintin' there?
Nothing. Everything. An invisible portrait of my own artistic impotence.
Looks like Doctor Loboto to me.
That is my patron, my psychiatrist, my warden.
Is he the one who chained you up?
Art therapy is all about commitment, child.
The Doctor won't let me go until I complete my treatment.
So, why don't you just finish the painting and go home?
Why... don't I... just...
heavy, bull-like breathing and grunting as he paints
Wow! See, sometimes you just have to--
Huh. You painted a bullfight over the Doctor's face. Why a bull fight?
Huh? Huh Edgar? Why do you--
EVERY TIME!
Every time it is the same!
The matador! The bull! How I despise you both!
But my hands... won't let you go.
Ahhhhhh!
The blank canvas, like the matador's cape, waves before me.
Infuriating. Alluring. Just like the pitiful horned beast in the painting, I know it is a trick-and yet I charge again and again. And every time I lose.
That is why I am here, chained in more ways than you can see.
A prisoner of art.
Well, I'm going downstairs. You good?
I'm good.
Excuse me, sir?
My name is Napoleon Bonaparte!
Oh! Uh... excuse me... Mr. Bonaparte?
Shhh! I only THINK I'm Napoleon Bonaparte.
Do not listen to the weakling! He denies his lineage because he fears it!
You'll have to excuse me. I'm busy losing a battle with my sanity here.
For France!
I like your jacket. Very strappy!
You want it? You can have it! Just help me undo these buckles in the back and--
What are you doing?! The uniform of this army is sacred! We shall wear it proudly until the battle is over.
(Help me!)
Allons enfants!
Enfants de la Patrie!
Le jour de gloire est arrivé!
Ha ha! Soon we shall feast upon the sweet, buttery snails of victory!
Ahh! Reinforcements!
March-ez-vous!
Back on your horse, soldier! Tout de suite!
Now, then...
Ha!
Ha ha!
Hah hah hah hah hah!
Into Napoleon's trap, you have fallen!
Ah, my trusted spy! Tell me what you know!
Weakling! Shut up! You call yourself by the name Bonaparte?
You are a stinking disgrace to your family, stinker!
This golden day is ours!
The sun is bright, the enemy is weak, and there is cheese back in the tent.
Le Charge!
Le Fire!
We are on our way back to town!
Let's take it to the chateaux, boys!
Another easy victory for Napoleon Bonaparte!
More wine!
Oh, man. Where's my cannon? Did we lose a cannon?
This is the worst. I hate this stupid game.
I don't want to play anymore!
I'm going to lose, I'm going to lose, I'm going to lose...
What am I supposed to do?
Retreat!
I thought I had a spy! Where'd I put my dang spy?
Everything's on fire! We're all going to burn!
Oh oh oh!
Everything's going black.
He calls this a game, but all I see is death.
These boys are too young to die. I'M too young to die!
Flank! No. Wait, uh, counter flank! No, uh uh unflank?
Do the other thing!
Where are my reinforcements?
I never asked for this war!
Hey, can we take a break? I need a quick disco nap.
Why aren't you attacking?
I am your commanding officer! You have to listen to me! That is an actual rule!
Why are you all working against me?
You think I'm dumb don't you?
I may be dumb, but I'm in charge!
Stop dying! Get up and stop dying!
Run over there and poke that guy with your gun knife thing!
Where'd everybody go? Is everybody dead?
Okay, everybody who's still in my army, please raise your hands, unless you are dead.
Uggg! Why won't that guy just shut up?
Look, we're not just an army. We are a family, and today we all have to pull together and kill.
Kill for daddy!
Hey, I'm tired too. But you don't see me lying down in the shade, now do you?
Oh, you want a court martial too? I got one for you too! And you, buddy!
Hmmm. What is this? Are you working on an abstract piece? Nice use of color...
Attack!
No, wait! Don't listen to him! Retreat!
Shut up you fool! The battle is ours! Wellington is on the run! This is our moment of glory!
Ah, shut up you loon!
Heh heh.
The battle can't be won. We're going to lose it.
I'm afraid you lost it years ago, Fred. Now pipe down over there. I am the orderly and I run a quiet, peaceful insane asylum. Understood?
Oh, now, see? You've disrupted Mr. Teglee's art therapy session.
Ha ha! Le jour de gloire est arrivé!
Whatever.
When it is your wish to travel across the lake, you may return to either shore and summon me with that.
Thanks, Hulking Lungfish. You know, you really aren't as hideous as people say.
You may call me now by my true name, Razputin. The name given to me by my people.
And what name is that, noble lake creature?
Linda.
What a magical lady.
Grrr!
Arg!
Man!
Consarnit.
(Sigh.)
Stupid Doctor Loboto.
Ouch!
Oh, man. I got another itch.
Ah-ah-ah...
Ah-ah-ah-ahh...
Ah-ah-ah-ah-ahchooo!
(Sniff.)
(Cough.)
(Snarf.)
(Snotty breathing.)
Raz! You came!
Of course I did! We gotta get you out of here!
Look! The Coach must have lured Sasha and Milla here on "official Psychonauts business" and then ambushed them with sneezing powder! They're completely brainless!
I know. I saw their brains downstairs. Listen, first things first. I was thinking about what you said about us making out.
Yeah?
Oh, man. I'm so glad he showed up! I was just starting to feel slightly less phlegmy.
Wait, he didn't just hear--
Ah! Get away from me! Stop reading my mind. Go re-brain Sasha and Milla so they can help us break this lock!
Worthless! These brains are worthless, Sheegor! Just like the one in your head!
Oh, no, no, they're nice. They're--they're nice brains, Doctor Loboto. Really!
They're TOO nice! They won't fight! I need killers! I need angry brains!
I squeeze 'em, I poke 'em, I twist 'em! What do I have to do to make 'em fight? Maybe I should try my drill?
I'm not going to bring you anymore brains if you're going to be so mean to them!
Oh, you're not, are you?
No.
No matter what I do?
No. No matter... what.
Not even if I--
No! Don't!
Not even if I cook you a little--
Don't. Doctor, no!
A little turtle soup?
Please, Doctor Loboto. No!
Huh? A nice hot turtle soup, hmm hmm?
Nothing better on a cold night like this than some boiling hot soup!
Leave Mr. Pokeylope alone!!!
Oh, okay.
(Pant pant.)
You sure?
NO! I mean, YES!
All right, all right.
Oh, why don't I just go ahead and heat you up a cup?
Pleeeeease!
It's made of turtles! Turtles that you love!
Isn't that right, Mr. Pokeylope?
Stop it stop it stop it stop it stop it stop it!
Okay, okay.
(pant)
Well, maybe I'll just make some for myself.
Bring me a good brain, Sheegor, or Mr. Pokeylope becomes Mr. Smokey-lope!
Ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Huah-huah-huah!
Smokey-lope. HAAAAAA!
When you're a dentist, you have to learn to have a sense of humor, you know. It helps to calm the patients down.
Rrrr.
Lili!
Grrrr!
(Gasp!)
Well, I've reviewed your chart, little girl.
And the bad news is, we're gonna have to remove your brain
...strap it into an armored battle tank and make it shoot down innocent civilians with its concentrated psychic death beam!
I'm gonna kill you so much.
The good news is that your insurance is going to cover the whole thing, so--
Heyyy, is it getting warm in here?
No, I'm just trying to set you on fire through this stupid hat!
What a delightfully mean little brain you have. Just what we want!
Here, do me a favor. Tell me if you think this smells like... your DOOM! Heh heh.
(Snotty breathing.)
(Sniff sniff.) I can't smell anything.
Curses!
Heh heh.
You're a stubborn little ball of phlegm, ain't ya?
Well, that head cold won't protect you forever, little girl, and when it's gone you'll be sneezing a different tune!
A tune in the key of... BRAINS! Ha ha ha!
Hey, slow down there, speedy. Let's talk about this.
Can't stop. Must make... final delivery... to this address.
(Gasp!) M-M-Mr. Pokeylope?
Oh, Mr. Pokeylope! (Kiss kiss.) I was so scared!
Ahhh!
Super... sneezing... powder.
Ahh! Try... not... to... sneeze!
Have... to... hold it... in
Ah ah--
ACHOO!
TV?
Oh, this is just great.
Now what am I going to do?
Have to think!
Ha. Like I got a choice...
Ha ha! Back to Russia with you, invader!
Don't leave me alone in here!
Is he really gone? Hello? Hello? Anyone else in here?
Hah! We did it, Raz! I'm all me again! One person! Not French!
Get me out of this dang jacket so I can go strangle me an orderly!
Hey, good thinking, Fred! That sure would save me a lot of work.
Yup! Right after I take a nap!
Yes, a--what? Nap?
(Sigh) War is hell, Razputin, and I'm sleepy. (Yawn) I'll take care of Crispin for you, just as soon as I... zzzzzz
Oh man.
(Snore.)
Finally! If that thing gave me a cowlick, Coach Oleander's gonna burn.
At least he never got inside your brain. It's going to take me weeks to get my rhythm back!
Razputin, you have surprised us yet again. I cannot thank you enough for what you've done.
Hey, hey. All in a day's work for a Psychonaut.
Ha ha. Well... PSI CADET, you mean.
Hey, the Psychonauts should be so lucky to get someone like Raz. The brain he's got in there is--
Is one in a million! Thanks to all of you for bringing it straight to my door!
(Gasp!)
Oleander!
You!
You took all my friends' brains, you turned an innocent fish into a giant monster, you stole all the teachers--DERAILING MY EDUCATION--AND you kidnapped--
MY GIRLFRIEND!
Razputin, this fight is too big for you.
Back home I had to clean up after the elephants, so trust me, I know how to take care of this ugly, little pile of--
Kids, let the grown-ups handle this.
You tall people!
Sasha!
We get to kill him too!
Ahhhhh!
Well, it's official. The genius is back!
Time to go get ready for my gallery show.
Rrrrrrr... Ahhh!
Uh-oh. This looks bad.
(Sniff sniff, sniff)
Ah, well, that's good. Someone must have turned off the gas long ago.
Oh, here's what my poor flowers need! A little water!
Oh, no. I spilled all my turpentine and acetone!
Hey, Boyd. Long time no see!
Oh, Mr. Orderly. I did not see you there. I was just taking a little therapeutic walk in the moonlight
Relax. The asylum's closed. We can all go home.
Leave? Here?
Yeah, this place is for crazy people. And I don't know about you but I ain't crazy no more!
I have to tell you, I'm feeling pretty good.
You know, maybe it is time for us all to move on.
What do you think, Boyd?
You ready to blow this popsicle stand?
The Milkman has completed his route.
You guys want to split a cab?
And the crib wasn't even that clean!
I mean, what do I have to do to get those guys to take me seriously?
When are you going to shut up and kiss me?
Um... I can hear that.
I know.
Surrender!
Never!
The Psychonauts have a word for people who turn on their own!
Ha! I don't need the Psychonauts anymore! I'm making my own army! Got a word for that?
Yeah. Gesundheit!
Heh?
Ah... ahh... ahhhh AHCHOO!
Hey, that was my fight! I was ready for that one!
Always in such a rush, Razputin. It takes years before you're ready for combat of that magnitude.
You'd be surprised, Nein. This one's been acing all my extra credit exams.
I beat the Coach once already, and I can do it again.
Darling, that was just a remote projection of the Coach. He wasn't as strong as he would be...
...if he were to appear... in the real world.
Teeee Veee?
Ha ha ha!
Teee VEEE?
Where's his brain?
Oh, probably stuck in one of his plans to take over the world somewhere.
Ha ha!
Hey. How's the weather down there.
Ah, finally. Alone at last, eh Razputin?
Glad you're finally picking on someone your own size!
Yes, I've been dying for a chance to... PICK YOUR BRAIN.
Two can play that game!
Yeah, but only one can win!
Bwah ha ha ha!
Now you're back, Mr. Pokeylope, and you'll tell us what to do!
Right? You've got a plan or something, right Mr. Pokeylope?
Right???
That's right baby. Daddy's here. Everything's gonna be alllll right.
Now here's what we're gonna do.
Mmm. Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Mmm. Okay. Uh-huh. Uh-hmmm. Uh-hmmm
(Mutter mutter.)
Sacré bleu! I have been hit!
OH!
Now, who threw that?
If you don't like the performance, a simple "boo" will do.
Gah!
Not another tracking device!
Oh, you found my old trophy!
I should really put that thing away, before somebody hurts themselves on that gleaming, metal, clawlike part on the top.
Say, would you like to hear the story of how I won that award, dear boy?
Or are you trying to take it, because you don't think I deserve it?
No, no. You deserve it!
I didn't take anything from you! I didn't ask to be famous! I just wanted you to love me!
Hey...
What?
YOU'RE SUPPOSED TO BE DEAD!
Oh, you're back to...
Take away everything I've worked for because you're jealous!
My award! Trying to leave me
Just like everybody else!
Back where you were my old friend. No one walks out on
Gloria Von Gouten!
Now, that's all the time I can give you, Mr. Reporter. I love the press, but simply must get back to the fans!
Excuse me, ma'am, but did you see a girl--
Have you crows seen a--
Hey! I was talking to you, jerks!
Hey, could you guys hold still for a minute?
I'm trying to read your minds.
Gah, it's no use! All they think about is worms.
So gross.
How about you?
Seen any suspicious characters around here lately?
Yeah, yeah. Bugs are delicious.
Tell me something I don't already know.
I don't suppose you all want to pull together and lift me up into that tower?
Yeah, yeah. Caw, caw, caw!
I don't want to hang it there. It's part of my costume!
Gloria didn't win that trophy for me to mess around with it.
She won it so I could use it as a disguise!
Finally! Recognition for my acting talents!
Raaar!
Guess I'm locked outside.
I don't wanna tickle that right now.
Wow.
Ow!
Hey!
Careful, there, now!
Nice and easy...
You gotta get rid of that mangy old brain, so he'll use my pretty one instead.
Throw away that old mangy brain!
Put me up on that pedestal, so he'll use me in the tank.
or...
The tank's empty!
Now's your chance!
Throw me in there!
Throw me into the Brain Tank!
If we could just get my beautiful mind into that tank's brain chamber, I could do some real damage!
Good!
Almost!
What's going on! What's that sound?
Oh the insane asylum just blew up. But don't worry. Mr. Pokeylope helped me save all the brains before it fell down.
Mr. Pokeylope?
Sam? Is that you? It's me, Linda. From the lake?
Linda. I haven't seen you in ages. You look so... different.
Uh, yeah. I've put on a little weight.
Ah, you know I don't mind that onnnnne bit.
Oh, Sam. You haven't changed at all!
Ah ha ha!
(pant!)
Eek!
Eep!
Yeep!
Ah!
Grrk!

BRAIN.

Well, we'll soon have all that excess tissue removed, and then we can slip that brain into something more comfortable.
SHEEGOR!
That package General Oleander mentioned has arrived.
Please take it up to the holding area and keep it fresh until I'm ready...
...to stick in my thumb, and pull out a... plum!
Ha ha ha ha!
I tried to warn you.
Please don't make him any more angry than he is! Mr. Pokeylope's life is on the line!
That was the last time I'll get caught, I promise!
Listen, the man you're working for is a deranged lunatic!
I know! I hate him, but if I don't do what he says, he'll... he'll

Gaahhhhh...

I'll have to extract Mr. Pokeylope from his prison using my psychic powers.
After which, this Loboto character should be fairly trivial to neutralize.
Yes, because once we get Mr. Pokeylope back, he'll tell us what to do.
He always tells me what to do.
Yes...
Oh, poor Mr. Pokeylope.
He never hurt anyone.
Oh, please don't let anything happen to him.
I wish he were here right now so he could tell me what to do.
Mr. Pokeylope!
I made him his favorite chocolate cake, and he can't even come up here to enjoy it.
Boo hoo hoo!
(Whimpery tears.)
Don't worry, Mr. Pokeylope. I'll guard your body and we'll get your brain back really soon. It's doing important work right now. It's on a mission.
I warned you not to come up here! They know you're coming!
They're going to take your brain!
Yes you are! Yes you are!
Mr. Pokeylope, he's my king!
La la la la everything!
What's that Mr. Pokeylope?
Uh huh. Uh huh.
Hee hee hee hee hee hee!
You're so funny Mr. Pokeylope.
Hee hee hee.
Aw. So cute.
Someone's got chocolate breath! Someone does!
Oh mwah, mwah, mwah!
Mwah mwah mwah!
(Kiss!)
So... did you say they knew I was coming?
Yeah. That little army man ought to be here any second.
Ow! Quit it!
Maybe they're right. Maybe you are mean and they should put your brain in one of those tanks.
Or else Mr. Pokeylope here will bite you on the pinky toe. Isn't that right Mr. P?
Don't even try it.
Ooohhhhh ohhhhhohhhh...
Oh, poor Mr. Pokeylope doesn't even know that I made his favorite cake today. He loves chocolate cake so much. If only he knew!
(she cries)
Dr. Loboto. I have a new brain for you. It's...
It's a really, really good one.
That's what you always say, Sheegor.
No, this one is really special. It's a fighter.
Oh, just leave it there and I'll get to it right after I'm done with this experiment!
O-o-okay.
Don't worry, baby. Just make sure I get put in that ol' tank and Daddy will take care of business.
I can't watch!
It's time to make the soup!
Ahhhh! Ahhhhh!
Ahhhhhhhhhhhh!
Milla!
LILI!!!

Talking to myself.
Okay enough with the disguise.
The things I do for Lili's brain.

That's a very advanced procedure. How did you know how to do it?
Well, I've studied it a little

Well, if you can lead us to them--
We can bring them back to their owners... immediately...

Immediately after we break young Ms. Zanotto here out of her restraints.
Careful!
Maybe try it at the same time!
Raz! Come on! We need your help!
Oof!
It's getting hot.
That almost went in my eye.
If I didn't have this hat on, I'd bust this thing myself.
Harder!
Come on!
Break!
What did he make this out of?

Are you sure you're using prime oscillations?

NNg.
Ha!
Ohhhh.
Grr.
Let's synchronize our sub harmonic pulses.
At the same time. One, two, three!

Oh, hold on. Maybe this way.
Okay, now I'm really mad.
Hang on, Lili.
Raz, darling. Why aren't you helping?
Hm. This elevator is locked up tight.
Nope. Doesn't look like it's going to budge.
That's the express elevator up to Doctor Loboto's lab.
Hm. Judging from its position...
I can take this elevator all they way down to the asylum grounds.
I'm pretty high up. I hope this ride isn't too--
Scary!
Well at least it's fast.
Excellent. There it is.
Good work, Sheegor.
Now all we have to do is get it in the Brain Tank somehow.
Ready to give up that jacket now?
Hey, I'm always ready to give up. Anything!
Oh no! I think I hear the enemy's bugles! They're rallying another attack!
Huh huh! My blood runs hot with passion for battle!
Oh, no. What's this? A secret weapon?
Put me down this instant or I will have you drawn and quartered!
That's okay, I'm used to getting beat.
Ha! Come on. Even Wellington hit harder than that!
Whoa wait a second...
I like war! War is fun! Victory is important to me.
No it is not! It is terrible. It is like eating British food every day.
Oooh, that was weird.

ZZZZzzzZZZZzzz
ZzzZZZZZZz-zzzz

Zzzz... What? No. Zzzzz

Just running a couple strategy ideas through my head...
What a haunting sound.

Mm, not today I'm afraid.

I'm still on the battlefield back in Waterloo. Oh no...
Wait, hold on.
That was strange.

Which I love to break! Ha ha!

You were losing anyway.
Oh just shut up and let me pout alone, will you.
I want to play again!
Interesting. Well, that's a possible strategy I guess.

With all the flammable chemicals I have in here, that would be a disaster.
Ah, you try my patience, Razputin!
Nobody lifts Edgar Teglee!
I uh oh... Who chained this building to my leg?
I... really wish I had some pastels... Or water colors

So, did you not see a girl come through here?
Handsome, I'm not the stage director. I don't track the entrances and exits.

I can't remember the last time I came out here at night. It's so beautiful, isn't it?
These plants could use a little water though. Now where's that hose?
Ooh, sounds like one of the French horns in the orchestra is a little flat.
Pleasure to meet you. I'd sign your shell, but I haven't got a pen.
Oooooh...
Ah, that's fame for you. Red hot one moment, and cooling off the next.
Oooh, now I know this isn't supposed to happen.
Ooh!
OoooOooohhh ooohhhooooOOOoo..

Benny. Huh. I thought it would be smaller.
Elka Doom. Maybe I should let J.T. have some time alone before I return this brain.
Kitty's brain. You know, I hate to say it, but it IS better groomed than the rest of the brains.

Hmmmmmmm.

Uh oh...

Oh, great. Now what am I supposed to do?
It's not like I can reach a regular restroom when I'm all chained up like this.

I feel like I know him so well, having practically lived in his skin earlier today.
I'd never get it through that shield.

Alright, so maybe I do, but I still can't get in there.
I believe I shall happily retire... while I'm still young.
You, you're part of it! Stay away!
